description.narrative: Farmsecure is having a significant developmental impact by promoting a more productive and sustainable agri-business model in South Africa. The Project is expected in turn to make a significant contribution to South Africa''s rural economic development, as well as to global food security by increasing access to sustainable and profitable farming structures for farmers. This means that Farmsecure''s focus includes the empowerment of farmers with scientific farming skills, agricultural knowledge and technologies, and hands-on support to assist farmers in fulfilling their maximum potential both in terms of yield and revenues, positioning the Company ahead of the field in the region''s agricultural development. Farmsecure works on a commercial farming basis with a long term goal to further develop small scale farming supported by the infrastructure of sustainable commercial farming.

The Project consists of an up to R500mn (~$65mn) funded risk participations in Standard Chartered Bank South Africa (SCB or the Bank) financing facilities to the Farmsecure group of companies (Farmsecure or the Group), for the provision of pre-harvest working capital to contracted farmers in grains and livestocks and own production in fruits. The facilities also cover other working capital needs of the Group. Among others, the financing facility will be used for input financing (e.g. seeds, fertilizer, agrochemicals), purchase of weaner calves/lambs for rearing and payment of insurance premiums and other marketing expenses.
